docs.lead_paragraph: Daimler AG said it will recall one million newer-model Mercedes-Benz vehicles worldwide due to the risk of fire, after 51 fires were reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: South Sudan has arrested four soldiers after residents accused the army of beating and raping civilians in a small village near the capital last month, a military spokesman said on Friday, in a case that became a symbol of spiraling military abuses.

headline.print_headline: South Sudan Military Arrests Soldiers Over Gang-Rape Accusation

docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's lower house of Congress is likely to vote on a plan to reform the country's pension system in the second half of April, House Speaker Rodrigo Maia said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former journalist fired for fabricating details in stories made at least eight of the scores of threats against Jewish institutions nationwide, including a bomb threat to the Anti-Defamation League, as part of a bizarre campaign to harass and frame his ex-girlfriend, federal officials said Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: South African rugby coach Allister Coetzee will from July only be able to select overseas-based players who have more than 30 international caps in a policy aimed at protecting the domestic game.
